column1:
A Comprehensive Dataset for
Australian Mine Production, 1799-2021
Author: Gavin M. Mudd
Environmental Engineering, RMIT University

Version 1.4b (22 May 2023)
(previously v1.0 24 January 2023, 1.1 30 January 2023, 1.2 16 February 2023, 1.3 21 February 2023, 1.4a 8 May 2023)
Any use of this data must include a correct citation to this source, along with the journal paper in Nature Scientific Data.
Acknowledgements

This compilation has been developed over many, many years - all librarians, agency staff and colleagues who have helped along the way are kindly acknowledged. The current motivation to update and expand these data was to support Geoscience Australia's National Atlas of Mine Waste (search online).

Whilst much of this research has been compiled for academic research on sustainable mining, at times the efforts have enjoyed financial support from CSIRO and Geoscience Australia.

All indigenous groups and interests in lands where mining has occurred, continues at present or could in the future, are rightfully acknowledged.
Abstract:

This data publication is a comprehensive synthesis of production from mines across Australia, including individual mines or fields as well as annual time series data by state. All care has been taken in the preparation of these data, however, some aspects remain incomplete (e.g., refinery by-products) or estimated based on best available data or information (e.g., concentrates). All data are considered the best synthesis possible of public sources.

All users of these data do so at their own risk.

Key references, publications and data sources are noted below.

If there are contributions to add to these data, please contact the author at RMIT.
Key Assumptions & Points to Note:
• All sources used adopted their own quality control and can be considered reliable for the purposes of this compilation.

• Data represents the contained metal or minerals within a saleable product leaving a mine gate (e.g., contained metal or minerals in concentrates, doré bars, direct shipping ore, refined metal, saleable ore). (Note: contained metal is not the same as payable metal, which is what a mine gets paid for after deductions by a smelter / refinery).
• Where necessary, mineral products have been converted to show contained metal (or element / elements) (e.g., tungsten in wolfram or scheelite, individual platinum group elements).
• All prices are indicative export prices only, based on reported metal or mineral content, presented as unit price ($/t).
• Monetary values have been converted to Australian dollars ($), with £ multiplied by 2 to give $.
• Every effort has been made to avoid double counting, but there may still be some data overlap.

• All units are metric (e.g., 1 tonne is 1 million grams; g/t are grams per tonne; % is per cent; kt is thousand tonnes; Mt is mega or million tonnes); except diamonds which are in carats (where 1 carat = 0.2 grams).
• The vast majority of data is calendar year, but from the 1980s onwards some data is financial year (i.e., July to June).
• Where value only was reported, this has been converted to metal / mineral based on average prices for that year.
• Whilst every effort has been made to reconcile conflicting data sources, some conflicts and inconsistencies remain - if there is a need to address this, please contact the author.

• It is anticipated that additional updates will be included in future (e.g., years beyond 2021, additional minerals) - if there is a desire for help with particular research or analyses, the author is most willing to be consulted and may be able to help.
• Very minor differences remain between mine production time series (e.g., mined Cu production in column BP) and totals in the Summary or Mine by Mine tabs.
• Any errors - or even additional data to amend or add - please contact the author.
Principal References - National:

Kalix, Z, Fraser, L M & Rawson, R I, 1966, Australian Mineral Industry: Production and Trade, 1842-1964. Commonwealth Bureau of Mineral Resources, Geology and Geophysics (BMR; now Geoscience Australia), Canberra, ACT, Australia, Bulletin 81, 482 pages.
BMR, Annual Mineral Industry Review. Commonwealth Bureau of Mineral Resources, Geology and Geophysics (BMR; now Geoscience Australia), Canberra, ACT, Australia, Years 1948 to 1987.

ABARE, Australian Mineral Statistics (quarterly journal). Australian Bureau of Agricultural and Resource Economics (ABARE; now Australian Bureau of Agricultural and Resource Economics & Sciences), Canberra, ACT, Australia, Years 1988 to 2011.

ABARE, Australian Commodity Statistics (annual series). Australian Bureau of Agricultural and Resource Economics (ABARE; now Australian Bureau of Agricultural and Resource Economics & Sciences), Canberra, ACT, Australia, Years 1995 to 2010 (formerly Commodity Statistical Bulletin, 1986-1994).

OCE, Resources and Energy Statistics (quarterly series). Office of the Chief Economist (OCE, formerly part of Bureau of Resources & Energy Economics, BREE), Canberra, ACT, Australia, Years 2011 to 2022.
Principal References - Tasmania:
TDM, Annual Report (annual series). Tasmanian Department of Mines (TDM; now Mineral Resources Tasmania), Hobart, TAS, Australia, Years 1882 to 1991/92.
MRT, Annual Review (annual series). Mineral Resources Tasmania, Hobart, TAS, Australia, Years 1992/93 to 2010/11.
Principal References - Victoria:

Brough Smyth, R, 1869, The Gold Fields and Mineral Districts of Victoria With Notes on the Modes of Occurrence of Gold and Other Metals and Minerals. Victorian Government Printer, Reprinted by Queensberry Hill Press 1979, Melbourne, VIC, Australia, 644 pages.

VDM, Annual Report (annual series). Victorian Department of Mines (VDM; now Earth Resources Regulation, part of Department of Energy, Environment & Climate Action), Melbourne, VIC, Australia, Years 1870 to 2007.

VDM, Gold Fields Statistics (annual & quarterly series). Victorian Department of Mines (VDM; now Earth Resources Regulation, part of Department of Energy, Environment & Climate Action), Melbourne, VIC, Australia, Years 1860 to 1918.

VDM, Gold and Mineral Statistics (annual series). Victorian Department of Mines (VDM; now Earth Resources Regulation, part of Department of Energy, Environment & Climate Action), Melbourne, VIC, Australia, Years 1919 to 1949.

VDM, Statistics Relating to the Mining Industry (annual series). Victorian Department of Mines (VDM; now Earth Resources Regulation, part of Department of Energy, Environment & Climate Action), Melbourne, VIC, Australia, Years 1950 to 1976.

VDM, Statistical Review (annual series). Victorian Department of Mines (VDM; now Earth Resources Regulation, part of Department of Energy, Environment & Climate Action), Melbourne, VIC, Australia, Years 1997/98 to 2020/21.
Principal References - New South Wales:
NSWDM, Annual Report (annual series). New South Wales Department of Mines (NSWDM; now Resources Regulator, Department of Regional NSW), Sydney, NSW, Australia, Years 1875 to 1989/90.
NSWDMR, Mineral Industry Review (annual series). NSW Department of Mineral Resources (NSWDMR; now Resources Regulator, Department of Regional NSW), Sydney, NSW, Australia, Years 1980 to 2010.
Miscellaneous minerals production statistics published online (e.g., Department websites).
Principal References - Queensland:
QDM, Annual Report (annual series). Queensland Department of Mines (QDM; now Department of Resources), Brisbane, QLD, Australia, Years 1877 to 1991/92.

QDNRM, Queensland Minerals and Petroleum Review (annual series). Queensland Department of Natural Resources and Mines (QDNRM; now Department of Resources), Brisbane, QLD, Australia, Years 2002 to 2008.

QDNRM, Queensland Metalliferous and Industrial Minerals (annual series). Queensland Department of Natural Resources and Mines (QDNRM; now Department of Resources), Brisbane, QLD, Australia, Years 2011 to 2016.
Miscellaneous minerals production statistics published online (e.g., Department websites).
Principal References - South Australia:

SADM, Mining Review: A Short Review of Mining Operations in the State of South Australia (6-monthly series). South Australian Department of Mines (SADM; now Department for Energy and Mining), Adelaide, SA, Australia, Years Dec. 1903 to Dec. 1988.

SADM, Mineral Production Statistics (6-monthly series). South Australian Department of Mines and Energy (SADME; now Department for Energy and Mining), Adelaide, SA, Australia, Years Dec. 1978 to Dec. 2021.
Principal References - Northern Territory:

DNT, Annual Report of the Administrators of the Northern Territory (annual series). Commonwealth Department of the Northern Territory (DNT; note – department no longer exists), Darwin, NT, Australia, Years 1911 to 1969/70.

Balfour, I S (Editor), 1989, Administrator's Reports for the Warramunga Gold Field (Tennant Creek) 1924-1969. NT Department of Mines and Energy (NTDME; now Mining and Energy within Department of Industry, Tourism and Trade), Darwin, NT, Australia.

Balfour, I S (Editor), 1990, Government Resident's Reports - The Top End Goldfields (Agicondi, Waggaman, Daly River & Katherine) 1870-1910. NT Department of Mines and Energy (NTDME; now Mining and Energy within Department of Industry, Tourism and Trade), Darwin, NT, Australia.

Balfour, I S (Editor), 1991, Administrator's Reports - The Top End Goldfields (Agicondi, Waggaman, Daly River & Katherine) 1911-1969. NT Department of Mines and Energy (NTDME; now Mining and Energy within Department of Industry, Tourism and Trade), Darwin, NT, Australia.
Ahmad, M & Munson, T J (Editors), 2013, Geology and Mineral Resources of the Northern Territory. Northern Territory Geological Survey, Darwin, NT, Australia, Special Publication 5.
Principal References - Western Australia:
WADM, Annual Report (annual series). Western Australian Department of Mines (WADM; now Department of Mines, Industry Regulation and Safety), Perth, WA, Australia, Years 1894 to 1991/92.
WADM, Statistics Digest (6-monthly series). Western Australian Department of Mines (WADM; now Department of Mines, Industry Regulation and Safety), Perth, WA, Australia, Years 1984 to 2020/21.
Miscellaneous References or Sources:
Company reports to the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX) (quarterly, annual, media releases) and websites.
Technical Reports (environmental impact statements, mineral resource reports, feasibility studies, etc).

Scientific papers, technical monographs (e.g., bulletins, research reports, Australasian Institute of Mining and Metallurgy monographs, books and conference proceedings), textbooks, academic theses, conference presentations, etc.
Anonymous (Editor), The Mineral Industry: Its Statistics, Technology and Trade. McGraw-Hill Book Company, Years 1892 to 1940, New York, USA (issues up to 1921 available from the Internet Archive).
USBoM, Minerals Yearbook. US Bureau of Mines (USBoM; no longer exists), Washington DC, USA, Years 1932 to 1993.
USBoM, Mineral Commodity Summaries. US Bureau of Mines (USBoM; no longer exists), Washington DC, USA, Years 1978 to 1995.
USGS, Minerals Yearbook. US Geological Survey (USGS), Washington DC, USA, Years 1994 to 2018 (including advance data releases to 2021), Volumes 1 Metals and Minerals and 3 International.
USGS, Mineral Commodity Summaries. US Geological Survey (USGS), Reston, Virginia, USA, Years 1996 to 2023, www.usgs.gov/centers/national-minerals-information-center/mineral-commodity-summaries.

Mudd, G M, 2009, The Sustainability of Mining in Australia: Key Production Trends and Their Environmental Implications for the Future. Department of Civil Engineering, Monash University and Mineral Policy Institute, Melbourne, VIC, Australia, October 2007; Revised April 2009, 277 pages.
RIU, Register of Australian Mining. Resource Information Unit (RIU), Perth, WA, Australia, Years 1978 to 2006.
LP & Minmet, The Australian Mines Handbook. Louthean Publishing Pty Ltd (LP) and Minmet Australia Pty Ltd (Minmet), Perth, WA, Australia, Years 1978 to 2005.
Abbreviations:
conc
column2: concentrate - a metal-rich residue extracted from ore for further processing at a smelter and/or refinery

column1: ore
column2: rock material processed to extract metals and/or minerals (i.e., economic or profitable)

column1: tailings
column2: residual rock material remainined after extraction of metals and/or minerals

column1: UG
DSO
column2: direct shipping ore (i.e., sent away interstate or exported overseas for further processing or use)

column1: Group
column2: a collection of mines operated as a single project (e.g., using a central mill)

column1: Field
column2: a small to modest-sized region hosting numerous mines (e.g., gold field)

column1: PGEs
column2: platinum group elements, comprising platinum (Pt), palladium (Pd), rhodium (Rh), ruthenium (Ru), osmium (Os) and iridium (Ir)

column1: REO
column2: rare earth oxides (i.e., the lanthanide series of elements)

column1: States
QLD
NSW
VIC
TAS
SA
WA
NT
Note: This synthesis does not include industrial and construction minerals and materials (e.g., aggregates, sand, barite, limestone, clays, dimension stone, etc).
